results.title: Walmart Gunman Bought Pistol Hours Before Killing and Left a ‘Death Note’
results.abstract: A message found by the police on the killer’s phone asked God to forgive him for targeting co-workers, whose deaths were the latest in a string of mass shooting fatalities.

media.caption: A memorial outside the Walmart in Chesapeake, Va., where a gunman fatally shot six people on Tuesday night.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.title: Why Does the U.S. Have So Many Mass Shootings? Research Is Clear: Guns.
results.abstract: Americans advance a lot of theories for why they have so many more gun deaths than other countries do. The answer is lying in plain sight.

results.byline: By Jin Yu Young and Victoria Kim
results.title: ‘Gangnam Style’ Brought K-Pop to the World, but Haunted Its Creator
results.abstract: In 2012, the song took over the internet, and it helped pave the way for the global success of Korean pop. But Psy, the artist behind it, spent years trying and failing to replicate the phenomenon.

media.caption: Psy during an interview on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of his hit “Gangnam Style,” at his office in Seoul (specifically, in the Gangnam area).
media.copyright: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

results.abstract: “The Chosen,” a TV series about the life of Jesus, pulls off a crowd-funded miracle: a hit with a Christian fan base that is breaking into the mainstream.

media.caption: Actors playing Jesus’ apostles handed out bread and fish to extras in Texas, re-enacting a miracle described in the Bible.

results.abstract: The man, Merrill Darrell Fackrell, 41, of Syracuse, Utah, was on a JetBlue flight from New York to Salt Lake City when he held the blade near a passenger’s throat, federal prosecutors said.

media.caption: A Utah man is facing federal charges alleging that he threatened a fellow passenger on a flight to Salt Lake City from New York on Monday.

results.title: United States Enters a New Era of Direct Confrontation With Iran
results.abstract: The Biden administration has imposed new sanctions on Tehran and expressed support for protesters, as the Iranian government aids Russia in the Ukraine war and continues nuclear enrichment.

media.caption: A protest in Tehran in September. The antigovernment demonstrations were kindled by the arrest and death of Mahsa Amini.
